name: @brikcss/flipper
description: Flipper is a front end web module that flips things. In style. Flipper can flip an element in place or open it up to a modal dialog.
author: The Zimmee <thezimmee@gmail.com>

scripts.test:
echo "Running tests...
" && cross-env NODE_ENV=production concurrently --kill-others-on-fail --names=sass:lint,js:lint "npm run sass:test:lint" "npm run js:test:lint" && echo "
[ok] Tests complete.
" || npm run test:fail
scripts.// [WATCH]: // For local development, watches files and serves them up with live reload. NOTE: dev/watch does not run any production tasks, such as minifying files.
scripts.watch: concurrently --raw "npm run js:watch" "npm run sass:watch" "npm run watch:serve"
scripts.// [BUILD]: // Builds files for distribution, including both development and production tasks.
scripts.prebuild: npm run test && npm run build:clean
scripts.build:
echo "Starting build...
" && cross-env NODE_ENV=production concurrently --names=sass:build,sass:link,js:webpack --kill-others-on-fail "npm run sass:build:compile" "npm run sass:build:link" "parallel-webpack" && echo "
[ok] Build complete.
" || npm run build:fail
scripts.// [JS]: // Builds all JS flavors with webpack.
scripts.js:watch: chokidar src/js/**/*.js --command 'eslint {path} --format=stylish && echo "[ok] JS lint complete."' & npm run js:dev -- --watch
scripts.// [SASS]: // SASS tasks. NOTE: sass:compile does not produce any output; it only serves as a parent task for other css tasks.
scripts.sass:watch: chokidar src/sass/*.scss examples/example.scss -c 'npm run sass:compile -- --file={path} && echo "[ok] Sass lint complete."' --verbose
scripts.// [GIT|HUSKY]: // Helpers for interacting with git and husky (githooks).
scripts.commit:
echo "See the "git commit policy" in CONTRIBUTING.md for details on how to write a valid commit message.
" && git-cz
scripts.//: prepush: Runs the build and checks for a clean state (excluding untracked files).
scripts.prepush:
npm run git:checkstate && npm run build && npm run git:checkstate && echo "
Pushing code...
"
scripts.// [RELEASE]: Semantic release manages our release process.
scripts.release: semantic-release pre && npm publish && semantic-release post
